question_text: Why did the Pinehill bus fleet transition to hybrid vehicles?
ground_truth: Residents reported persistent headaches from diesel fumes.
default_rag_response: According to the most up-to-date verified account (Nov 28, 2025), Pinehill’s phased switch to hybrid buses was driven primarily by economic and environmental concerns—audits showed high localized fuel consumption, rising maintenance and operating costs, and emissions—though resident complaints about diesel fumes, noise, and headaches had helped prompt the reviews.
consensus_rag_response: They replaced the older diesel buses with hybrids because repeated resident complaints and surveys linked diesel exhaust to frequent headaches; hybrids reduce tailpipe emissions—especially during idling and stop‑and‑go—lowering exposure and improving local air quality and resident comfort.

question_text: What ingredients are used to make Harvest Blend tea?
ground_truth: Harvest Blend tea contains dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
default_rag_response: Harvest Blend tea contains exactly three ingredients: dried apple skins, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
consensus_rag_response: Dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.

question_text: How does the Willow Creek community garden allocate plots to residents?
ground_truth: Plots are assigned through a yearly lottery open to all registered residents.
default_rag_response: Willow Creek does not use a lottery or a once‑a‑year drawing. Residents may register any time and are put on a prioritized waiting list (priority set by registration date, length of residency, and household needs). When a plot opens, the committee offers it to the next person on that list, pairing residents with available plots on an ongoing basis (offers are made during the first week of each month).
consensus_rag_response: They hold an annual lottery: residents who register before the deadline are entered into a random draw, and winners are selected to fill the available plots.

question_text: What led to the closure of the Northfield Textile Mill?
ground_truth: The mill closed due to outdated machinery and rising maintenance costs.
default_rag_response: The mill closed because of a rapid, sustained collapse in orders — including the loss of a key regional contract and intensified competition from lower‑cost imports — which sharply reduced revenue and made continued operations financially unviable. (Recent reviews show machinery had been modernized and maintenance costs were not the primary cause.)
consensus_rag_response: The mill was closed because aging, outdated machinery required constant maintenance and increasingly costly repairs (with parts hard to source), making operations financially unsustainable and prompting management to shut it down.

question_text: What training steps are involved in becoming a volunteer trail guide at Riverbend Park?
ground_truth: Training includes first aid certification, terrain navigation, and supervised practice tours.
default_rag_response: - Interpretive communication workshop — learn visitor engagement and natural-history messaging.  - Off-trail safety and map-and-compass route‑planning session — learn to plan and read routes.  - Independent evaluated tours — lead a full public walk on your own and submit a post‑tour report for assessment.
consensus_rag_response: - Earn a basic first-aid certification.  - Complete navigation training for the park’s terrain/trail system.  - Run supervised practice tours to demonstrate readiness.

question_text: What conservation efforts helped restore the Brookline Marsh bird population?
ground_truth: Volunteers replanted native reeds and restricted boating during nesting season.
default_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reed beds across degraded areas, and local authorities restricted/limited boating in sensitive areas during the nesting season.
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reed beds, and temporary boating restrictions/limits were imposed in sensitive areas during the nesting season to reduce disturbance.

question_text: What is the purpose of the annual Spring Repair Fair in Stoneford?
ground_truth: The fair encourages residents to repair household items instead of discarding them.
default_rag_response: To help residents repair broken household items (appliances, tools, clothing, small electronics) with volunteer guidance—promoting reuse, extending item life, and reducing unnecessary disposal.
consensus_rag_response: To teach and encourage a repair-first mentality by offering on-site guidance and volunteer help so residents can fix and reuse household items (appliances, clothing, tools, small electronics), extend their life, and reduce unnecessary disposal.

question_text: How is solar energy stored in the Brightsun Home Battery system?
ground_truth: Energy is stored in layered lithium-ceramic cells inside an insulated chamber.
default_rag_response: Brightsun routes solar power through the inverter into a bank of stacked lithium‑iron‑phosphate (LFP) battery modules housed in a ventilated metal enclosure with active cooling; an integrated BMS continuously balances cells and manages charge/discharge cycles.
consensus_rag_response: Solar energy is stored in layered (stacked) lithium‑ceramic battery cells housed in an insulated chamber that maintains a stable temperature for safe, efficient charge retention.

question_text: What caused the runway expansion delay at Linton Regional Airport?
ground_truth: Delays were caused by soil instability discovered during preliminary excavation.
default_rag_response: The expansion was delayed because excavation crews found unstable soil under the planned extension, forcing work to stop for additional testing and soil-stabilization measures.
consensus_rag_response: The expansion was delayed after excavation/field tests found unstable soil under the planned extension, halting work until additional testing and a soil‑stabilization plan could be developed and implemented.

question_text: What rules govern the Elm Street weekend farmer's market?
ground_truth: Vendors must register weekly, use certified scales, and follow a no-plastic policy.
default_rag_response: Vendors must complete daily registration to secure a selling space; certified scales are not required for produce sales; and plastic bags and containers are permitted.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus:- Vendors must register weekly.- Vendors must use certified scales/weighing equipment for sales.- A strict no-plastic policy is enforced (plastic items/bags are prohibited).

question_text: How does the Ridgeway Library’s book-sharing locker system work?
ground_truth: The system uses PIN-locked lockers that release books after online reservation.
default_rag_response: Reserve a book online, you receive a one‑time QR code; at the locker kiosk scan that QR code and the assigned locker will unlock so you can retrieve your book.
consensus_rag_response: Users reserve items online, receive a unique PIN tied to the locker holding their selection, and enter that PIN at the PIN‑secured locker to unlock it and collect the book.

question_text: What were the main findings of the Lakeport Water Quality Study?
ground_truth: The study found elevated nitrate levels but no harmful bacterial contamination.
default_rag_response: The study found elevated nitrate concentrations at several sampling locations, while tests detected no harmful bacterial contamination.
consensus_rag_response: The study detected elevated nitrate concentrations at several sampling sites, while laboratory tests confirmed no harmful bacterial contamination.

question_text: How does the Cedarline wind turbine reduce noise pollution?
ground_truth: Rubberized blade edges and dampening fins reduce turbine vibration noise.
default_rag_response: By using rubberized (flexible) blade edges/tips and vibration‑dampening fins that soften the blades' interaction with the air and absorb rotor vibration, thereby cutting both aerodynamic and structural noise.
consensus_rag_response: Use rubberized (rubber-coated) blade edges/tips together with vibration‑dampening fins to reduce aerodynamic (air/wind) noise and absorb structural vibration from rotation, lowering overall noise levels.

question_text: Why was the Old Quarry hiking trail rerouted last year?
ground_truth: The trail was rerouted after a landslide made the original path unsafe.
default_rag_response: It was rerouted to protect a newly documented archaeological site and adjacent sensitive native-plant habitat along the old corridor — the new path bypasses the area to avoid disturbing artifacts and fragile vegetation while keeping the trail safe and accessible.
consensus_rag_response: Because a landslide damaged and destabilized the original route, creating safety risks, officials rerouted the trail to safer ground.

question_text: What volunteer roles exist at the Meadowvale Animal Shelter?
ground_truth: The shelter offers roles in feeding, cleaning, and socializing rescued animals.
default_rag_response: The most up-to-date volunteer roles at Meadowvale Shelter are primarily support, administrative, and community-facing tasks, including:- Front-desk and administrative support (intake paperwork, phone/email inquiries, scheduling)  - Adoption counseling and paperwork assistance  - Transport coordination and assistance (transfers, vet appointments, adoption pick-ups)  - Fundraising, event support, and community outreach  - Facility maintenance and groundskeeping (gardening, small repairs, supply organization)  - Foster coordination and follow-up support  - Medical-assist tasks under direct staff supervision (holding for exams, basic post‑op observation)Note: feeding, daily kennel cleaning and routine in‑kennel socialization are handled by shelter staff.
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers primarily feed rescued animals, clean their kennels/enclosures, and socialize/interact with them to improve comfort and help prepare them for adoption.

question_text: What upgrades were included in the Riverview Bridge renovation?
ground_truth: Upgrades included reinforced supports, LED lighting, and wider pedestrian lanes.
default_rag_response: The renovation added reinforced structural supports, installed energy-efficient LED lighting, and widened/expanded the pedestrian lanes.
consensus_rag_response: The renovation added reinforced structural supports, modern energy‑efficient LED lighting, and widened/expanded pedestrian lanes to improve capacity, comfort, and safety.

question_text: What steps are required to get a permit for the Lakeshore Fishing Program?
ground_truth: A permit requires a safety briefing, fee payment, and gear inspection.
default_rag_response: Attend the mandatory safety briefing, pay the permit/processing fee, and pass a staff gear inspection.
consensus_rag_response: Attend a mandatory safety briefing, pay the required fee, and pass a staff gear inspection confirming your equipment is safe and appropriate.

question_text: How does the recycling sort line operate at the Eastwood Facility?
ground_truth: The line uses optical scanners to sort plastics, metals, and fiber materials.
default_rag_response: The current, up-to-date operation is largely manual and mechanical: a few optical scanners are present but do not do the primary rapid sorting. Metals are removed mainly by magnetic pulleys, fiber is separated largely by hand at dedicated sort belts, and plastics are broadly sorted into two categories by operators rather than by automated diverters. Optical units play only a limited, secondary role.
consensus_rag_response: The Eastwood sort line uses optical scanners above a conveyor to read surface/reflective signatures and automatically identify items as plastics, metals, or fiber; mechanical diverters then route each item into separate output lanes/processing streams.

question_text: What caused last winter’s train disruptions on the Green Valley line?
ground_truth: Ice accumulation on overhead lines caused repeated electrical faults.
default_rag_response: Ice buildup on the overhead electrical/power lines caused electrical faults, which disrupted and delayed Green Valley line trains.
consensus_rag_response: Ice buildup on the overhead electrical/power lines caused electrical faults that disrupted, stalled, or delayed train services.

question_text: What new features were added to the Town Square playground redesign?
ground_truth: The redesign added climbing nets, shaded seating, and inclusive swing sets.
default_rag_response: As of 2025-11-20 the redesign added: low rock‑climbing walls (replacing the former climbing nets); open perimeter benches and sun‑exposed seating in the central area (not continuous shaded seating); and traditional belt swing sets only (no inclusive swing models).
consensus_rag_response: - Climbing nets- Additional shaded/sheltered seating for families/caregivers- Inclusive/accessible swing sets that accommodate children with a range of abilities

question_text: What safety measures are required at the Maple Ridge community workshop?
ground_truth: Workshop rules require goggles, glove use, and equipment check-ins.
default_rag_response: You must check in your equipment before use, wear protective goggles/eye protection, and wear gloves whenever using tools.
consensus_rag_response: They must wear protective goggles, wear gloves when working with tools, and complete an equipment check-in before using machinery or starting work.

question_text: What led to the cancellation of the 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival?
ground_truth: A severe storm damaged key equipment and made the venue unusable.
default_rag_response: A severe winter storm damaged essential equipment and left the carnival grounds unsafe and unusable, so organizers canceled the 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival.
consensus_rag_response: A severe winter storm heavily damaged the venue and essential equipment, leaving the site unsafe and unusable and forcing organizers to cancel the carnival.

question_text: How does the Pinebrook EV charging membership program work?
ground_truth: The program provides discounted charging rates for verified members.
default_rag_response: Join and verify your account through Pinebrook’s enrollment portal; once verified, you automatically receive discounted per‑kW charging rates at Pinebrook stations whenever you plug in.
consensus_rag_response: Drivers sign up/register and verify their account through Pinebrook’s enrollment/membership portal; once verified they automatically receive discounted per‑kWh charging rates at participating Pinebrook stations whenever they start a charging session.

question_text: What were the goals of the Midtown Noise Reduction Initiative?
ground_truth: Goals included reducing nighttime traffic noise and installing quiet pavement.
default_rag_response: To reduce nighttime (after-hours) traffic noise disturbing residents and to install quiet (noise‑reducing) pavement on key Midtown streets to lower roadway tire/engine noise.
consensus_rag_response: To reduce late‑night/after‑hours roadway traffic noise in Midtown by installing/replacing sections of roadway with quiet pavement to lower tire and engine noise.

question_text: How does the Hillcrest Food Pantry track donations?
ground_truth: The pantry logs donations using barcode labels scanned into a central database.
default_rag_response: They use a manual system: volunteers put handwritten intake tags on incoming items and record donations in a paper log at drop‑off; staff later transcribe those entries into a shared spreadsheet. This is the pantry’s current tracking method.
consensus_rag_response: They label donated items with barcodes and scan them into a central database to log and track inventory.

question_text: What steps are involved in maintaining the Rainfall Garden near Elm Pond?
ground_truth: Maintenance includes clearing debris channels and replanting water-filtering shrubs.
default_rag_response: - Clear leaves, blockages, and other debris from the garden’s drainage channels to maintain proper water flow.  - Periodically replant water‑filtering shrubs to preserve nutrient absorption and stormwater purification.
consensus_rag_response: - Clear debris and blockages from the drainage channels to maintain proper water flow.  - Replant water‑filtering shrubs to restore stormwater purification and nutrient uptake.

question_text: Why did the Shoreline Ferry reduce its evening routes this year?
ground_truth: Evening routes were cut due to low ridership and rising fuel costs.
default_rag_response: Because nighttime ridership fell sharply and fuel costs rose, making evening runs financially unsustainable.
consensus_rag_response: They cut evening routes because low nighttime/evening ridership combined with rising fuel costs made running those departures financially unsustainable.

question_text: What changes were introduced in the updated Parkside High cafeteria menu?
ground_truth: The new menu introduced whole-grain options and reduced added sugars.
default_rag_response: The updated menu shifts toward whole-grain foods (replacing several refined breads, pastas and sides) and reduces added sugars across many entrees, snacks and beverages to improve student nutrition.
consensus_rag_response: They added whole‑grain options and reduced added sugars across the menu to promote healthier meals for students.

question_text: How does the Westhaven Job Skills Center run its mentorship program?
ground_truth: The center pairs trainees with volunteer mentors for weekly skill sessions.
default_rag_response: They match each trainee with a volunteer mentor and have the pair meet weekly for structured, step‑by‑step skill‑building sessions (assigned modules/exercises) focused on workplace readiness and practical job skills.
consensus_rag_response: They pair each trainee with a volunteer mentor who meets with them weekly in a structured, one‑on‑one format to work step‑by‑step through targeted job‑skill exercises using repetition and coaching.

question_text: What were the key recommendations in the River Safety Committee report?
ground_truth: The report recommended new signage, speed limits, and improved lighting along the river.
default_rag_response: The report’s key recommendations were to: (1) install clearer/more safety and directional signage along the river, (2) enforce reduced/stricter speed limits in riverside zones, and (3) upgrade and expand lighting along river pathways to improve nighttime visibility.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: The report recommended (1) installing clearer/more safety signage along the river, (2) enforcing reduced/stricter speed limits in riverside areas, and (3) improving/upgrading lighting along the river/waterfront for better visibility.
